fields.description:
Customer is reporting deadlock errors post upgrade. Below is an example of such errors:



{code:java}
[root@esclos031000 eucalyptus]# tail -f postgresql-Thu.log

2017-09-28 13:35:20 EESTERROR: deadlock detected 
2017-09-28 13:35:20 EESTDETAIL: Process 21682 waits for ShareLock on transaction 50094033; blocked by process 1510. 
Process 1510 waits for ExclusiveLock on tuple (222,9) of relation 17040 of database 779071; blocked by process 21682. 
Process 21682: update eucalyptus_simpleworkflow.swf_workflow_execution set creation_timestamp=$1, last_update_timestamp=$2, version=$3, metadata_display_name=$4, metadata_last_state=$5, metadata_state=$6, metadata_state_change_stack=$7, metadata_account_id=$8, metadata_unique_name=$9, metadata_user_id=$10, metadata_user_name=$11, cancel_requested=$12, close_status=$13, close_timestamp=$14, decision_status=$15, decision_timestamp=$16, latest_activity_timestamp=$17, latest_execution_context=$18, retention_timestamp=$19, timeout_timestamp=$20 where id=$21 and version=$22 
Process 1510: update eucalyptus_simpleworkflow.swf_workflow_execution set creation_timestamp=$1, last_update_timestamp=$2, version=$3, metadata_display_name=$4, metadata_last_state=$5, metadata_state=$6, metadata_state_change_stack=$7, metadata_account_id=$8, metadata_unique_name=$9, metadata_user_id=$10, metadata_user_name=$11, cancel_requested=$12, close_status=$13, close_timestamp=$14, decision_status=$15, decision_timestamp=$16, latest_activity_timestamp=$17, latest_execution_context=$18, retention_timestamp=$19, timeout_timestamp=$20 where id=$21 and version=$22 
2017-09-28 13:35:20 EESTHINT: See server log for query details. 
2017-09-28 13:35:20 EESTSTATEMENT: update eucalyptus_simpleworkflow.swf_workflow_execution set creation_timestamp=$1, last_update_timestamp=$2, version=$3, metadata_display_name=$4, metadata_last_state=$5, metadata_state=$6, metadata_state_change_stack=$7, metadata_account_id=$8, metadata_unique_name=$9, metadata_user_id=$10, metadata_user_name=$11, cancel_requested=$12, close_status=$13, close_timestamp=$14, decision_status=$15, decision_timestamp=$16, latest_activity_timestamp=$17, latest_execution_context=$18, retention_timestamp=$19, timeout_timestamp=$20 where id=$21 and version=$22 
2017-09-28 13:35:20 EESTERROR: deadlock detected 
2017-09-28 13:35:20 EESTDETAIL: Process 1881 waits for ShareLock on tuple (222,9) of relation 17040 of database 779071; blocked by process 1510. 
Process 1510 waits for ShareLock on transaction 50094034; blocked by process 8304. 
Process 8304 waits for ExclusiveLock on tuple (222,9) of relation 17040 of database 779071; blocked by process 1881. 
Process 1881: insert into eucalyptus_simpleworkflow.swf_workflow_history_event (creation_timestamp, last_update_timestamp, metadata_perm_uuid, version, event_attributes, event_order, event_type, workflow_execution_id, id) values ($1, $2, $3, $4, $5, $6, $7, $8, $9) 
Process 1510: update eucalyptus_simpleworkflow.swf_workflow_execution set creation_timestamp=$1, last_update_timestamp=$2, version=$3, metadata_display_name=$4, metadata_last_state=$5, metadata_state=$6, metadata_state_change_stack=$7, metadata_account_id=$8, metadata_unique_name=$9, metadata_user_id=$10, metadata_user_name=$11, cancel_requested=$12, close_status=$13, close_timestamp=$14, decision_status=$15, decision_timestamp=$16, latest_activity_timestamp=$17, latest_execution_context=$18, retention_timestamp=$19, timeout_timestamp=$20 where id=$21 and version=$22 
Process 8304: update eucalyptus_simpleworkflow.swf_workflow_execution set creation_timestamp=$1, last_update_timestamp=$2, version=$3, metadata_display_name=$4, metadata_last_state=$5, metadata_state=$6, metadata_state_change_stack=$7, metadata_account_id=$8, metadata_unique_name=$9, metadata_user_id=$10, metadata_user_name=$11, cancel_requested=$12, close_status=$13, close_timestamp=$14, decision_status=$15, decision_timestamp=$16, latest_activity_timestamp=$17, latest_execution_context=$18, retention_timestamp=$19, timeout_timestamp=$20 where id=$21 and version=$22 
2017-09-28 13:35:20 EESTHINT: See server log for query details. 
2017-09-28 13:35:20 EESTCONTEXT: SQL statement "SELECT 1 FROM ONLY "eucalyptus_simpleworkflow"."swf_workflow_execution" x WHERE "id"::pg_catalog.text OPERATOR(pg_catalog.=) $1::pg_catalog.text FOR SHARE OF x" 
2017-09-28 13:35:20 EESTSTATEMENT: insert into eucalyptus_simpleworkflow.swf_workflow_history_event (creation_timestamp, last_update_timestamp, metadata_perm_uuid, version, event_attributes, event_order, event_type, workflow_execution_id, id) values ($1, $2, $3, $4, $5, $6, $7, $8, $9) 
^C 
[root@esclos031000 eucalyptus]#
{code}
fields.summary: Seeing EESTERROR: deadlock detected errors in postgresql post cloud upgrade

comments.body: Logs are forthcoming. Working with the customer on getting a full sosreport from the CLC.
I found a couple hits on similar deadlocks seen in the past. Links above in the 'relates to' section.

This issue is likely related to the use of 4 ufs hosts. In a default configuration the long polling used by simple workflow clients uses 24 pollers per host, so 96 when there are 4 ufs hosts. If this is causing issues then reducing the per service pollers will help, e.g.:

{code}
# euctl cloudformation.swf_workflow_worker_config='{ "DomainRetentionPeriodInDays": 1, "PollThreadCount": 2, "MaximumPollRateIntervalMilliseconds": 50, "MaximumPollRatePerSecond": 20 }'
# euctl cloudformation.swf_activity_worker_config='{ "PollThreadCount": 4, "TaskExecutorThreadPoolSize": 16, "MaximumPollRateIntervalMilliseconds": 50, "MaximumPollRatePerSecond": 20 }'
# euctl services.loadbalancing.swf_workflow_worker_config='{ "DomainRetentionPeriodInDays": 1, "PollThreadCount": 2, "MaximumPollRateIntervalMilliseconds": 50, "MaximumPollRatePerSecond": 20 }'
{code}

which would change to 12 rather than 24 per per ufs host.

I believe in other deployments we have been running one instance of the simple workflow service which would eliminate most of the deadlocks since in-memory locking is sufficient for a single instance. 

It is easiest to test running with a single simple workflow service instance by stopping 3 of the services, e.g.:

{code}
# euserv-modify-service -s STOPPED my-simpleworkflow-service-name-here
{code} 

though this will only temporarily stop services. To move to a single simple workflow service instance you would register a new instance on the cloud controller and deregister the instances from the ufs hosts.

Changing simple workflow service configuration / registrations can impact the elb and cloudformation services which rely on it.

We just ran into this on our production system after upgrading from 4.3.1 to 4.4.2. We also are seeing a high volume of errors on the UFS nodes (we have 2 UFS nodes for reference)
{noformat}
2017-10-08 14:31:52  INFO | Activity task for domain LoadbalancingDomain, list LoadBalancerTasks not found
2017-10-08 14:31:52  INFO | Activity task for domain LoadbalancingDomain, list LoadBalancerTasks not found
2017-10-08 14:31:52  INFO | Activity task for domain LoadbalancingDomain, list LoadBalancerTasks not found
2017-10-08 14:31:53  INFO | Activity task for domain LoadbalancingDomain, list LoadBalancerTasks not found
2017-10-08 14:31:53  INFO | Activity task for domain LoadbalancingDomain, list LoadBalancerTasks not found
2017-10-08 14:31:54  INFO | Activity task for domain LoadbalancingDomain, list LoadBalancerTasks not found
2017-10-08 14:31:54  INFO | Activity task for domain LoadbalancingDomain, list LoadBalancerTasks not found
2017-10-08 14:31:54  INFO | Activity task for domain LoadbalancingDomain, list LoadBalancerTasks not found
2017-10-08 14:31:54  INFO | Activity task for domain LoadbalancingDomain, list LoadBalancerTasks not found
2017-10-08 14:31:54  INFO | Activity task for domain LoadbalancingDomain, list LoadBalancerTasks not found
2017-10-08 14:31:54  INFO | Activity task for domain LoadbalancingDomain, list LoadBalancerTasks not found
2017-10-08 14:31:54  INFO | Activity task for domain LoadbalancingDomain, list LoadBalancerTasks not found
{noformat}

We also have an internal ticket open for this issue, but i'll post relevant changes here as they occur.

[~sjones], I have attached the last hours worth of ERROR messages from UFS-01 and UFS-02. Please note that on UFS-01 SWF is enabled and on UFS-02 it is disabled. Not sure which of these errors would be relevant.
[^ufs-01-logs-swf-enabled.txt]  [^ufs-02-logs-swf-disabled.txt]

A simple workflow service deployed on a ufs host will use higher cpu than one deployed on the cloud controller. When the simple workflow service is on the cloud controller, communication with the pollednotifications service uses in-vm messaging rather than remote messaging so avoids the need for cpu intensive message ws-security.

Steve,

How do you deploy the SWF service only on the CLC, but leave the remaining services on the UFS node?

From: Steve Jones (JIRA) [mailto:jira@eucalyptus.atlassian.net]
Sent: Tuesday, October 10, 2017 3:20 PM
To: Gallucci, John C (US) <john.gallucci@baesystems.com>
Subject: [JIRA] (EUCA-13448) Seeing EESTERROR: deadlock detected errors in postgresql post cloud upgrade

*** WARNING ***
EXTERNAL EMAIL -- This message originates from outside our organization.


[ https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/browse/EUCA-13448?page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel&focusedCommentId=128014#comment-128014 ]

Steve Jones commented on EUCA-13448:

A simple workflow service deployed on a ufs host will use higher cpu than one deployed on the cloud controller. When the simple workflow service is on the cloud controller, communication with the pollednotifications service uses in-vm messaging rather than remote messaging so avoids the need for cpu intensive message ws-security.

Seeing EESTERROR: deadlock detected errors in postgresql post cloud upgrade

     Key: EUCA-13448

     URL: https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/browse/EUCA-13448

 Project: Eucalyptus

         Issue Type: Bug

   Affects Versions: 4.4.1, 4.4.2

Reporter: radams

        Attachments: ufs-01-logs-swf-enabled.txt, ufs-02-logs-swf-disabled.txt

Customer is reporting deadlock errors post upgrade. Below is an example of such errors: {code:java} [root@esclos031000 eucalyptus]# tail -f postgresql-Thu.log 2017-09-28 13:35:20 EESTERROR: deadlock detected 2017-09-28 13:35:20 EESTDETAIL: Process 21682 waits for ShareLock on transaction 50094033; blocked by process 1510. Process 1510 waits for ExclusiveLock on tuple (222,9) of relation 17040 of database 779071; blocked by process 21682. Process 21682: update eucalyptus_simpleworkflow.swf_workflow_execution set creation_timestamp=$1, last_update_timestamp=$2, version=$3, metadata_display_name=$4, metadata_last_state=$5, metadata_state=$6, metadata_state_change_stack=$7, metadata_account_id=$8, metadata_unique_name=$9, metadata_user_id=$10, metadata_user_name=$11, cancel_requested=$12, close_status=$13, close_timestamp=$14, decision_status=$15, decision_timestamp=$16, latest_activity_timestamp=$17, latest_execution_context=$18, retention_timestamp=$19, timeout_timestamp=$20 where id=$21 and version=$22 Process 1510: update eucalyptus_simpleworkflow.swf_workflow_execution set creation_timestamp=$1, last_update_timestamp=$2, version=$3, metadata_display_name=$4, metadata_last_state=$5, metadata_state=$6, metadata_state_change_stack=$7, metadata_account_id=$8, metadata_unique_name=$9, metadata_user_id=$10, metadata_user_name=$11, cancel_requested=$12, close_status=$13, close_timestamp=$14, decision_status=$15, decision_timestamp=$16, latest_activity_timestamp=$17, latest_execution_context=$18, retention_timestamp=$19, timeout_timestamp=$20 where id=$21 and version=$22 2017-09-28 13:35:20 EESTHINT: See server log for query details. 2017-09-28 13:35:20 EESTSTATEMENT: update eucalyptus_simpleworkflow.swf_workflow_execution set creation_timestamp=$1, last_update_timestamp=$2, version=$3, metadata_display_name=$4, metadata_last_state=$5, metadata_state=$6, metadata_state_change_stack=$7, metadata_account_id=$8, metadata_unique_name=$9, metadata_user_id=$10, metadata_user_name=$11, cancel_requested=$12, close_status=$13, close_timestamp=$14, decision_status=$15, decision_timestamp=$16, latest_activity_timestamp=$17, latest_execution_context=$18, retention_timestamp=$19, timeout_timestamp=$20 where id=$21 and version=$22 2017-09-28 13:35:20 EESTERROR: deadlock detected 2017-09-28 13:35:20 EESTDETAIL: Process 1881 waits for ShareLock on tuple (222,9) of relation 17040 of database 779071; blocked by process 1510. Process 1510 waits for ShareLock on transaction 50094034; blocked by process 8304. Process 8304 waits for ExclusiveLock on tuple (222,9) of relation 17040 of database 779071; blocked by process 1881. Process 1881: insert into eucalyptus_simpleworkflow.swf_workflow_history_event (creation_timestamp, last_update_timestamp, metadata_perm_uuid, version, event_attributes, event_order, event_type, workflow_execution_id, id) values ($1, $2, $3, $4, $5, $6, $7, $8, $9) Process 1510: update eucalyptus_simpleworkflow.swf_workflow_execution set creation_timestamp=$1, last_update_timestamp=$2, version=$3, metadata_display_name=$4, metadata_last_state=$5, metadata_state=$6, metadata_state_change_stack=$7, metadata_account_id=$8, metadata_unique_name=$9, metadata_user_id=$10, metadata_user_name=$11, cancel_requested=$12, close_status=$13, close_timestamp=$14, decision_status=$15, decision_timestamp=$16, latest_activity_timestamp=$17, latest_execution_context=$18, retention_timestamp=$19, timeout_timestamp=$20 where id=$21 and version=$22 Process 8304: update eucalyptus_simpleworkflow.swf_workflow_execution set creation_timestamp=$1, last_update_timestamp=$2, version=$3, metadata_display_name=$4, metadata_last_state=$5, metadata_state=$6, metadata_state_change_stack=$7, metadata_account_id=$8, metadata_unique_name=$9, metadata_user_id=$10, metadata_user_name=$11, cancel_requested=$12, close_status=$13, close_timestamp=$14, decision_status=$15, decision_timestamp=$16, latest_activity_timestamp=$17, latest_execution_context=$18, retention_timestamp=$19, timeout_timestamp=$20 where id=$21 and version=$22 2017-09-28 13:35:20 EESTHINT: See server log for query details. 2017-09-28 13:35:20 EESTCONTEXT: SQL statement “SELECT 1 FROM ONLY “eucalyptus_simpleworkflow"."swf_workflow_execution” x WHERE "id"::pg_catalog.text OPERATOR(pg_catalog.=) $1::pg_catalog.text FOR SHARE OF x” 2017-09-28 13:35:20 EESTSTATEMENT: insert into eucalyptus_simpleworkflow.swf_workflow_history_event (creation_timestamp, last_update_timestamp, metadata_perm_uuid, version, event_attributes, event_order, event_type, workflow_execution_id, id) values ($1, $2, $3, $4, $5, $6, $7, $8, $9) ^C [root@esclos031000 eucalyptus]# {code}

— This message was sent by Atlassian Jira (v1001.0.0-SNAPSHOT#100063)

[~sjones], I just implemented your fix by placing SWF on the CLC and stopping in on our two UFS nodes. The performance improvement was so massive I have to ask...why on earth would you ever run simpleworkflow on the UFS? The reason I say this is that our CPU load average on the UFS went from 5 to 1 for both nodes, and from 10 to 2 on the CLC node. The result was almost instantaneous after making the change.

This has also fixed another issue we were seeing with the Eucaconsole failing to list 50+ loadbalancers (due to timeout). We will continue to monitor our systems for errors and performance issues.

Thanks for the commands. I have always wanted to know how to do individual services like that.

When you install the cloud and register UFS you get all the services on all of the UFS servers.
Having SWF only on CLC would be a single point of failure.

A candidate fix with pessimistic locking is here:

https://github.com/sjones4/eucalyptus/commit/78abacc2eafd6adaa4e996a590795b4a30dcdfab?w=1

This candidate fix also reduces the log level for some expected log messages.

For the performance issue due to message signing we already have EUCA-13292.

A rough test before/after this locking change shows that before this fix using 4 ufs hosts is approximately half as fast as using a single host. After the fix using 4 ufs is approximately twice as fast as using a single ufs host (so ~4x faster)
[~sjones], this is great news. What is the process for installing the fix into an existing 4.4.2 system?
[~jgallucci32], the candidate/untested fix is a code change so cannot easily be added to a 4.4.2 system.
